Package nzilbb.ag.serialize

Interface GraphDeserializer

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    IDeserializer, IStoreDeserializer, StoreGraphDeserializer
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    JSONSerialization
    public interface GraphDeserializer
    Interface for deserializing a graph from streams of data.

    Deserialization takes place in the following phases:

    1. Configure deserializer using configure(ParameterSet,Schema)
    2. Load serialized form using load(NamedStream[],Schema), which returns a list of parameters that should be set.
    3. Set deserialization parameters using setParameters(ParameterSet)
    4. Generation graph(s) using deserialize()
    5. Possibly display or log warnings returned by getWarnings()
    Author:
    Robert Fromont robert@fromont.net.nz

    • Method Detail

      • getDescriptor

        SerializationDescriptor getDescriptor()
        Returns the deserializer's descriptor
        Returns:
        The deserializer's descriptor

      • configure

        ParameterSet configure​(ParameterSet configuration,
                       Schema schema)
        Sets parameters for deserializer as a whole. This might include database connection parameters, locations of supporting files, standard layer mappings, etc.

        When the deserializer is installed, this method should be invoked with an empty parameter set, to discover what (if any) general configuration is required. If parameters are returned, and user interaction is possible, then the user may be presented with an interface for setting/confirming these parameters. Once the parameters are set, this method can be invoked again with the required values.

        Parameters:
        configuration - The general configuration for the deserializer.
        schema - The layer schema, definining layers and the way they interrelate.
        Returns:
        A list of configuration parameters (still) must be set before setParameters(ParameterSet) can be invoked. If this is an empty list, setParameters(ParameterSet) can be invoked. If it's not an empty list, this method must be invoked again with the returned parameters' values set.

      • load

        ParameterSet load​(NamedStream[] streams,
                  Schema schema)
           throws SerializationException,
                  IOException,
                  SerializerNotConfiguredException
        Loads the serialized form of the graph, using the given set of named streams.
        Parameters:
        streams - A list of named streams that contain all the transcription/annotation data required, and possibly (a) stream(s) for the media annotated.
        schema - The layer schema, definining layers and the way they interrelate.
        Returns:
        A list of parameters that require setting before deserialize() can be invoked. This may be an empty list, and may include parameters with the value already set to a workable default. If there are parameters, and user interaction is possible, then the user may be presented with an interface for setting/confirming these parameters, before they are then passed to setParameters(ParameterSet).
        Throws:
        SerializationException - If the graph could not be loaded.
        IOException - On IO error.
        SerializerNotConfiguredException - If the configuration is not sufficient for deserialization.

      • setParameters

        void setParameters​(ParameterSet parameters)
            throws SerializationParametersMissingException
        Sets parameters for a given deserialization operation, after loading the serialized form of the graph. This might include mappings from format-specific objects like tiers to graph layers, etc.
        Parameters:
        parameters - The configuration for a given deserialization operation.
        Throws:
        SerializationParametersMissingException - If not all required parameters have a value.

      • deserialize

        Graph[] deserialize()
             throws SerializerNotConfiguredException,
                    SerializationParametersMissingException,
                    SerializationException
        Deserializes the serialized data, generating one or more Graphs.

        Many data formats will only yield one graph (e.g. Transcriber transcript or Praat textgrid), however there are formats that are capable of storing multiple transcripts in the same file (e.g. AGTK, Transana XML export), which is why this method returns a list.

        Returns:
        A list of valid (if incomplete) Graphs.
        Throws:
        SerializerNotConfiguredException - if the object has not been configured.
        SerializationParametersMissingException - if the parameters for this particular graph have not been set.
        SerializationException - if errors occur during deserialization.

      • getWarnings

        String[] getWarnings()
        Returns any warnings that may have arisen during the last execution of deserialize().
        Returns:
        A possibly empty list of warnings.
